title: Ring of the Octopus King
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | One of the eight rings once worn by the Octopus King and now scattered across the land. Each has its own unique enchantment.***"A mermaid who fancied to sing, Roused lust in the Octopus King. Her squiggly suitor, Tried hard to woo her, But she couldn't wear all his rings." |

[![Urand octoring.png](/images/f/f6/Urand_octoring.png)](/File:Urand_octoring.png) ***a ring of the Octopus King***  
+2 [HP](/HP "HP")  
+2 [AC](/AC "AC")  
+2 [EV](/EV "EV")  
+2 [SH](/SH "SH")  
One of the following properties: [rF+](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire"), [rC+](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold"), [rN+](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy"), [rCorr](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion"), [MP +9](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power"), [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry"), [SInv](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible"), or [Fly](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

Each ring worn also adds a +2 enchantment to the [trident of the Octopus King](/Trident_of_the_Octopus_King "Trident of the Octopus King").

## Desirability

There are technically eight different **rings of the Octopus King**.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) It is possible to find more than one in a single game, but finding all eight is extraordinarily unlikely (unless you complete an egregious number of [Ziggurats](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat")).

On their own, each ring is a step up from their mundane counterparts. Having +2 AC / +2 EV / +2 SH is better than a [ring of protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection"), and you get the original ring's property on top. Therefore, while it's not uncommon to find better [randart](/Randart "Randart") rings, these rings can be useful for any character.

Only an [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode"), with their ability to wear eight rings at once, can take full advantage of the rings' synergy with the Trident, but they'll still need to find them all first. And by the time that's done, they'll likely have found multiple high-powered randart rings.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), rings gave +1 to AC, EV, [strength](/Strength "Strength"), [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence"), and [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), rings generated with [Stealth](/Ring_of_stealth "Ring of stealth") instead of Flight.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), the rings' bonus to the trident of the Octopus King was +1 each. Also, rings generated with [sustain attributes](/Sustain_attributes "Sustain attributes") instead of [corrosion resistance](/Corrosion_resistance "Corrosion resistance").
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), rings generated with [Regen](/Ring_of_regeneration "Ring of regeneration") instead of SInv.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), rings generated with [Hunger-](/Ring_of_sustenance "Ring of sustenance") instead of Stealth+. Also, the rings did not increase the enchantment level of the trident of the Octopus King.
- The rings of the Octopus King were added in [0.10](/0.10 "0.10").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [artefact.cc:1796](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/artefact.cc#L1796) (0.30.1)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [art-data.txt:1264](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L1264) (0.30.1)
html:
Ring of the Octopus King

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
One of the eight rings once worn by the Octopus King and now scattered across the land. Each has its own unique enchantment.

"A mermaid who fancied to sing,
Roused lust in the Octopus King.
Her squiggly suitor,
Tried hard to woo her,
But she couldn't wear all his rings."

a ring of the Octopus King
+2 HP
+2 AC
+2 EV
+2 SH
One of the following properties: rF+, rC+, rN+, rCorr, MP +9, Wizardry, SInv, or Fly[1].

Each ring worn also adds a +2 enchantment to the trident of the Octopus King.

Desirability

There are technically eight different rings of the Octopus King.[2] It is possible to find more than one in a single game, but finding all eight is extraordinarily unlikely (unless you complete an egregious number of Ziggurats).

On their own, each ring is a step up from their mundane counterparts. Having +2 AC / +2 EV / +2 SH is better than a ring of protection, and you get the original ring's property on top. Therefore, while it's not uncommon to find better randart rings, these rings can be useful for any character.

Only an Octopode, with their ability to wear eight rings at once, can take full advantage of the rings' synergy with the Trident, but they'll still need to find them all first. And by the time that's done, they'll likely have found multiple high-powered randart rings.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, rings gave +1 to AC, EV, strength, intelligence, and dexterity.
  • Prior to 0.27, rings generated with Stealth instead of Flight.
  • Prior to 0.19, the rings' bonus to the trident of the Octopus King was +1 each. Also, rings generated with sustain attributes instead of corrosion resistance.
  • Prior to 0.16, rings generated with Regen instead of SInv.
  • Prior to 0.15, rings generated with Hunger- instead of Stealth+. Also, the rings did not increase the enchantment level of the trident of the Octopus King.
  • The rings of the Octopus King were added in 0.10.

References

  1. ↑ artefact.cc:1796 (0.30.1)
  2. ↑ art-data.txt:1264 (0.30.1)
